message: Could you explain why? I plan to make 2 better with details. The main issue is some found that "there are more bars on this site than a chinese prison"....for the first version...which I had to agree with.
Just finished a "potential" redesign thanks to some quality convore feedback. http://www.pubbsoft.com vs the new one at http://www.pubbsoft.com/fixedwidth/
1, without a doubt, as far as aesthetics go.
1 for sure
But you asked which is better, I'm going to choose #1 because of the curvy corners on #2
all is too rounded..

I'm not gonna lie, neither of them is very nice, and they're quite similar... they have a lot more in common than they have differences, the biggest issues I have with the original are still present in the "redesign"
they are almost similar in terms of placement of components. wide layout looks good as far as focus is concerned.

In #2 the corners with a large radius and bevel make elements look childlike. Try reducing the corner radius to 3-5px and reduce the bevel depth to 1px. I prefer #1 - the full width background looks open and expansive, while #2 looks cramped and confined.
I'm going to go ahead and say #1 just like everyone else and add that I think the idea for the app is pretty cool as well.

OK, more: I find the logo font extremely irritating. Doesn't look professional to me. Also the ellipsis at the end of your tag line makes it sounds wishy-washy or uncertain about what it says. But on the whole it's an OK design and usable but you've got a long way to go until it's jaw-dropping.
i.e. hire a designer to polish it off for you, if you can afford it.
Sorry, I'm very picky about these things for a living - it's quite nice and you've done a great many things well.
#1. It just feels much cleaner. I think #2 has too much of a "template" feel to it.
Thanks all. Sound like #1 is the main consensus. Maybe I'll keep a more polished version of 2 around for some a/b testing.
I like #2, but really the difference between these is very small compared to the difference you'll get with a better logo and colors
#1 . colors are hideous tho

agree with corners being too rounded.  Also I think some work needs to be done on the color choice / button outlining, etc.  go look at your favorite bay-area startup and see how they achieve simplicity in design.  airbnb.com flowtown.com massivehealth.com etc. all good examples
If you can afford it, we loved what http://www.ryanfosterdesign.com/ did for AdGrok.
I like the color scheme better in #2, but the lack of content is probably throwing people off...
First is better, you have some sick colors there but still is better than second version which is too raw at the moment.
